section.name: Accounting of business owner taxes, retained earnings.
section.p:
There are three Income Tax methods used in all countries:
income tax = rate * (business revenues - business expenses - allowances), and usually accrued method
income tax = rate * (business revenues - allowances), and usually cash method
income tax = fixed amount
Accrued means that business revenue/expense is occurred when you bought or sold something (goods, services, rent etc) even unpaid. Cash - when you earn money or paid ones, but not prepayments, i.e. for already sold/purchase goods/service. According IRS 583 Starting a business page 6 Bob as sole proprietor should pays Income Tax, Self-employment tax. He should pays estimated income tax by April 18 (see Form 1040-ES). For manufacturing (according IRS Capitalization Period of Direct and Indirect Costs) direct business expenses such as cost of goods sold is made automatically directly on gross income (business) expense account Cost Of Goods Sold (COGS). All other expenses is accounted on asset account Inventory capitalized cost (ICC). To calculate amount of Inventory capitalized cost to be expense it's used trial balance at the start and the end of the year and this equation:
1. Simplified Production Absorption Ratio = (ICC end - ICC start) / (Inventory end - Inventory start + COGS end) 2. ICC amount to be expense = (ICC end - ICC start) - Inventory end * Simplified Production Absorption Ratio
Bob's balance is zero at the start. For example at the end of the year Inventory = 1500USD, COGS = 240000USD, ICC = 25000USD. So Bob will makes accounting entries Debit COGS Additional Credit ICC for whole ICC = 25000 - 1500 * 25000 /(1500 + 240000) = 24844.72USD
Bob should makes several accounting entries for each type of expense (ICC - rent, payroll tax1, etc) by using Simplified Production Absorption Ratio.

After Bob has made all business revenues and expenses his gross income is:
gross income = sum(gross income revenue accounts) - sum(gross income expense accounts)
His Self-employment tax is also none-capitalized cost and gross income expense.
The final closing accounting entries are:
for each gross income revenue account for its final total: Debit [gross income revenue account] Credit Bob's earnings.
for each gross income expense account for its final total: Debit Bob's earnings Credit [gross income expense account].
Extract income tax from gross income: Debit Bob's earnings Credit Taxes Payable Federal Income Tax for tax amount.
